title: RMVMR
text: RMVMR can installed MRCIEU R-Universe install RMVMR directly GitHub repository, first make sure remotes package installed: RMVMR package can installed using: update package just run following command .
code: install.packages("RMVMR", repos = c("https://mrcieu.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("WSpiller/RMVMR") remotes::install_github("WSpiller/RMVMR")

title: RMVMR
text: written RMVMR R package perform radial multivariable Mendelian randomization analyses, including heterogeneity statistics assessing instrument strength validity. package accommodates number exposures less 6, currently includes range functions estimating causal effects, well assessing conditional instrument strength pleiotropic bias.

title: RMVMR
text: Spiller, W. Bowden, J Sanderson E. Estimating visualising multivariable Mendelian randomization analyses within radial framework. medRxiv, 2023.04.04.23288134, doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.04.04.23288134

title: RMVMR
text: project licensed GNU GPL v2.

title: format_rmvmr — format_rmvmr
text: Reads summary data. Checks organises columns use calculating multivariable Mendelian Randomization analyses. variant IDs provided, vector generated variant identification.

title: format_rmvmr — format_rmvmr
text: BXGs matrix containing beta-coefficient values genetic associations exposure. Columns indicate exposure number, rows representing estimates given genetic variant. BYG numeric vector beta-coefficient values genetic associations outcome. seBXGs matrix containing standard errors corresponding matrix beta-coefficients BXGs. seBYG numeric vector standard errors corresponding beta-coefficients BYG. RSID vector names genetic variants included analysis. variant IDs provided (RSID="NULL"), vector ID numbers generated.

title: format_rmvmr — format_rmvmr
text: formatted data frame additional classes rmvmr_format mvmr_format

title: format_rmvmr — format_rmvmr
text: Spiller, W., et al., Estimating visualising multivariable Mendelian randomization analyses within radial framework. Forthcoming.

title: format_rmvmr — format_rmvmr
text: Wes Spiller; Eleanor Sanderson; Jack Bowden.

title: format_rmvmr — format_rmvmr
code: f.data <- format_rmvmr(  BXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_beta","hdl_beta","tg_beta")],  BYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_beta,  seBXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_se","hdl_se","tg_se")],  seBYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_se,  RSID = rawdat_rmvmr$snp) names(f.data) #> [1] "SNP"      "betaYG"   "sebetaYG" "betaX1"   "betaX2"   "betaX3"   "sebetaX1" #> [8] "sebetaX2" "sebetaX3" class(f.data) #> [1] "data.frame"   "rmvmr_format" "mvmr_format"

title: ivw_rmvmr — ivw_rmvmr
text: Fits radial IVW multivariable Mendelian randomization model using first order weights.

title: ivw_rmvmr — ivw_rmvmr
text: r_input formatted data frame using format_rmvmr function object class MRMVInput MendelianRandomization::mr_mvinput summary logical argument (TRUE FALSE) indicating whether summary results presented (default= TRUE).

title: ivw_rmvmr — ivw_rmvmr
text: dataframe containing MVMR results, including estimated coefficients, standard errors, t-statistics, corresponding (two-sided) p-values.

title: ivw_rmvmr — ivw_rmvmr
text: Spiller, W., et al., Estimating visualising multivariable Mendelian randomization analyses within radial framework. Forthcoming.

title: ivw_rmvmr — ivw_rmvmr
text: Wes Spiller; Eleanor Sanderson; Jack Bowden.

title: ivw_rmvmr — ivw_rmvmr
code: # Example using format_rmvmr formatted data f.data <- format_rmvmr(     BXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_beta","hdl_beta","tg_beta")],     BYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_beta,     seBXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_se","hdl_se","tg_se")],     seBYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_se,     RSID = rawdat_rmvmr$snp) ivw_rmvmr(f.data, TRUE) #>  #> Radial Multivariable MR #>  #>               Estimate Std. Error    t value  Pr(>|t|) #> exposure1 -0.021845534 0.01417258 -1.5413941 0.1254465 #> exposure2  0.003735376 0.01033780  0.3613319 0.7183884 #> exposure3  0.025570592 0.01601916  1.5962501 0.1126561 #>  #> Residual standard error: 2.197 on 142 degrees of freedom #>  #>   # Example using MRMVInput formatted data from the #  MendelianRandomization package if (require("MendelianRandomization", quietly = TRUE)) { bx <- as.matrix(rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_beta", "hdl_beta", "tg_beta")]) bxse <- as.matrix(rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_se", "hdl_se", "tg_se")]) dat <- MendelianRandomization::mr_mvinput(bx = bx,                                           bxse = bxse,                                           by = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_beta,                                           byse = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_se,                                           snps = rawdat_rmvmr$snp) ivw_rmvmr(r_input = dat, summary = TRUE) } #>  #> Radial Multivariable MR #>  #>               Estimate Std. Error    t value  Pr(>|t|) #> exposure1 -0.021845534 0.01417258 -1.5413941 0.1254465 #> exposure2  0.003735376 0.01033780  0.3613319 0.7183884 #> exposure3  0.025570592 0.01601916  1.5962501 0.1126561 #>  #> Residual standard error: 2.197 on 142 degrees of freedom #>  #>

what: Convert an object of class MRMVInput from the MendelianRandomization package to the RMVMR rmvmr_format class — mrmvinput_to_rmvmr_format
title: Convert an object of class MRMVInput from the MendelianRandomization package to the RMVMR rmvmr_format class — mrmvinput_to_rmvmr_format
text: Creates data.frame additional classes rmvmr_format mvmr_format object class MRMVInput generated MendelianRandomization::mr_mvinput.

title: Convert an object of class MRMVInput from the MendelianRandomization package to the RMVMR rmvmr_format class — mrmvinput_to_rmvmr_format
Convert an object of class MRMVInput from the MendelianRandomization package to the RMVMR rmvmr_format class — mrmvinput_to_rmvmr_format
text: dat Object MendelianRandomization::mr_mvinput.

title: Convert an object of class MRMVInput from the MendelianRandomization package to the RMVMR rmvmr_format class — mrmvinput_to_rmvmr_format
text: data.frame additoinal classes rmvmr_format, RMVMR format, mvmr_format.

title: Convert an object of class MRMVInput from the MendelianRandomization package to the RMVMR rmvmr_format class — mrmvinput_to_rmvmr_format
code: if (require("MendelianRandomization", quietly = TRUE)) { bx <- as.matrix(rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_beta", "hdl_beta")]) bxse <- as.matrix(rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_se", "hdl_se")]) dat <- MendelianRandomization::mr_mvinput(bx = bx,                                           bxse = bxse,                                           by = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_beta,                                           byse = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_se,                                           snps = rawdat_rmvmr$snp) dat <- mrmvinput_to_rmvmr_format(dat) head(dat) class(dat) } #> [1] "data.frame"   "rmvmr_format" "mvmr_format"

title: pleiotropy_rmvmr — pleiotropy_rmvmr
text: Generates Q-statistics quantifying degree heterogeneity univariate Radial MR analyses applying correction using output ivw_rmvmr. function returns two data frames. first data frame includes global Q-statistic exposure applying correction, well corresponding p-value. second data frame contains individual Q-statistic SNP corrected univariate analyses, relative exposure given column exposure.

title: pleiotropy_rmvmr — pleiotropy_rmvmr
text: r_input formatted data frame using format_rmvmr function object class MRMVInput MendelianRandomization::mr_mvinput rmvmr object containing output ivw_rmvmr function class IVW_RMVMR.

title: pleiotropy_rmvmr — pleiotropy_rmvmr
text: object class "RMVMR_Q" containing following components: gq data frame containing global Q-statistic p-value applying correction exposure qdat data frame containing individual Q-statistic p-value SNP applying correction exposure

title: pleiotropy_rmvmr — pleiotropy_rmvmr
text: Spiller, W., et al., Estimating visualising multivariable Mendelian randomization analyses within radial framework. Forthcoming.

title: pleiotropy_rmvmr — pleiotropy_rmvmr
text: Wes Spiller; Eleanor Sanderson; Jack Bowden.

title: pleiotropy_rmvmr — pleiotropy_rmvmr
code: f.data <- format_rmvmr(     BXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_beta","hdl_beta","tg_beta")],     BYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_beta,     seBXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_se","hdl_se","tg_se")],     seBYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_se,     RSID = rawdat_rmvmr$snp) rmvmr_output <- ivw_rmvmr(f.data, FALSE) q_object <- pleiotropy_rmvmr(f.data, rmvmr_output) q_object$gq #>            q_statistic   p_value #> Exposure_1    39.00391 0.9999987 #> Exposure_2    32.72136 0.9999999 #> Exposure_3    33.84794 0.9998315 head(q_object$qdat) #>          snp        wj corrected_beta         qj       qj_p ref_exposure #> 1 rs10019888  9.638623    0.182234939 0.40143746 0.52634782   Exposure_1 #> 2 rs10468017 51.780930    0.001079676 0.02721426 0.86896961   Exposure_1 #> 3  rs1047891 12.076698    0.490835137 3.17425712 0.07480722   Exposure_1 #> 4 rs10761762  9.195911   -0.413504104 1.41062004 0.23495349   Exposure_1 #> 5 rs11045163 10.340424   -0.176298188 0.24667725 0.61942451   Exposure_1 #> 6 rs11065987 10.561270   -0.802588890 6.43772951 0.01117214   Exposure_1

title: plot_rmvmr — plot_rmvmr
text: Generates two radial multivariable Mendelian randomization (MVMR) plots. first plot shows shows estimated direct effect exposure obtained fitting radial MVMR model. data point shows square root weighting SNP x-axis, product ratio estimate square root weighting SNP y-axis. values obtained performing univariate radial MR analysis exposure using SNPs displayed, specifically use RadialMR::ivw_radial function. SNPs strongly associated corresponding exposure used, first stage F-statistic greater 10. second plot applies correction ratio estimate. plots, distance observation corresponding regression line proportional contribution SNP towards global heterogeneity.

title: plot_rmvmr — plot_rmvmr
text: r_input formatted data frame using format_rmvmr function object class MRMVInput MendelianRandomization::mr_mvinput rmvmr object containing output ivw_rmvmr function class IVW_RMVMR.

title: plot_rmvmr — plot_rmvmr
text: object class "RMVMR_plot" containing following components: p1 radial MVMR plot without correction p2 radial MVMR plot correction

title: plot_rmvmr — plot_rmvmr
text: Spiller, W., et al., Estimating visualising multivariable Mendelian randomization analyses within radial framework. Forthcoming.

title: plot_rmvmr — plot_rmvmr
text: Wes Spiller; Eleanor Sanderson; Jack Bowden.

title: plot_rmvmr — plot_rmvmr
code: f.data <- format_rmvmr(     BXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_beta","hdl_beta","tg_beta")],     BYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_beta,     seBXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_se","hdl_se","tg_se")],     seBYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_se,     RSID = rawdat_rmvmr$snp) rmvmr_output <- ivw_rmvmr(f.data, FALSE) plot_object <- plot_rmvmr(f.data, rmvmr_output) plot_object$p1  plot_object$p2

what: Raw multivariable MR summary data using lipid fractions as exposures and systolic blood pressure as an outcome. — rawdat_rmvmr
title: Raw multivariable MR summary data using lipid fractions as exposures and systolic blood pressure as an outcome. — rawdat_rmvmr
text: dataset containing summary data 145 genetic variants associated either low-density lipoprotein (LDL), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), triglycerides. Data includes variant rsid numbers, associations lipid fraction, associations genetic variants systolic blood pressure (SBP), corresponding standard errors.

title: Raw multivariable MR summary data using lipid fractions as exposures and systolic blood pressure as an outcome. — rawdat_rmvmr
Raw multivariable MR summary data using lipid fractions as exposures and systolic blood pressure as an outcome. — rawdat_rmvmr
text: data frame 145 rows 9 variables. Specifically includes following information: snp identification number variant ldl_beta association estimate genetic variant obtained regressing LDL-C upon genetic variant hdl_beta association estimate obtained regressing HDL-C upon genetic variant tg_beta association estimate obtained regressing triglycerides upon genetic variant sbp_beta association estimate SBP obtained regressing SBP upon genetic variant ldl_se standard error corresponding association estimate ldl_beta hdl_se standard error corresponding association estimate hdl_beta tg_se standard error corresponding association estimate tg_beta sbp_se standard error corresponding association estimate sbp_beta

title: Raw multivariable MR summary data using lipid fractions as exposures and systolic blood pressure as an outcome. — rawdat_rmvmr
text: http://www.mrbase.org/ https://www.nature.com/articles/ng.2797 https://www.nature.com/articles/ng.3768

title: Raw multivariable MR summary data using lipid fractions as exposures and systolic blood pressure as an outcome. — rawdat_rmvmr
strength_rmvmr — strength_rmvmr
text: Calculates Q-statistics quantifying instrument strength. exposure treated outcome sequentially, fitting remaining exposures within radial MVMR model. High Q-statistics indicate high instrument strength, comparable Q_x statistic conventional MVMR analyses. function outputs list plots, global Q-statistics, individual Q-contributions indexed exposure number ordered using format_rmvmr function. Named exposures list refer remaining exposures strength RMVMR model.

title: strength_rmvmr — strength_rmvmr
text: r_input formatted data frame using format_rmvmr function object class MRMVInput MendelianRandomization::mr_mvinput gencov Calculating heterogeneity statistics using MVMR package requires covariance effect genetic variants exposure known. can either estimated individual level data, assumed zero, fixed zero using non-overlapping samples exposure GWAS. value 0 used default.

title: strength_rmvmr — strength_rmvmr
text: object class "S_RMVMR" containing following components: plot list containing plots RMVMR analyses regressing exposure sequentially upon remaining exposures r_input object. Plots indexed exposure number serving outcome RMVMR analysis qstat list containing global Q-statistics RMVMR analyses regressing exposure sequentially upon remaining exposures r_input object. Indexing follows plots p-values global heterogeneity provided qall list containing individual Q-statistics data RMVMR analyses regressing exposure sequentially upon remaining exposures r_input object. Indexing follows plots

title: strength_rmvmr — strength_rmvmr
text: Spiller, W., et al., Estimating visualising multivariable Mendelian randomization analyses within radial framework. Forthcoming.

title: strength_rmvmr — strength_rmvmr
text: Wes Spiller; Eleanor Sanderson; Jack Bowden.

title: strength_rmvmr — strength_rmvmr
code: f.data <- format_rmvmr(     BXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_beta","hdl_beta","tg_beta")],     BYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_beta,     seBXGs = rawdat_rmvmr[,c("ldl_se","hdl_se","tg_se")],     seBYG = rawdat_rmvmr$sbp_se,     RSID = rawdat_rmvmr$snp) output <- strength_rmvmr(f.data) #> Warning: Covariance between effect of genetic variants on each exposure not specified. Fixing covariance at 0. #> Warning: Covariance between effect of genetic variants on each exposure not specified. Fixing covariance at 0.  # The following shows the strength plot and Q statistics for exposure 2, # regressing exposure 2 upon exposures 1 and 3 (which are labeled exposure 1 # and exposure 2 based on ordering in the RMVMR model).  output$plot[[2]]  output$qstat[[2]] #>            q_statistic       p_value #> Exposure_1    1377.211 6.618994e-230 #> Exposure_2    1057.544 8.171778e-177

title: RMVMR 0.4.1
text: Fixed bug plot_rmvmr() ggplot2::scale_x_continuous() calls. RMVMR now run version 4 ggplot2, due released soon.

title: RMVMR 0.4
text: RMVMR now required R 4.1.0 newer. requirement dependency package ggplot2, scales package, now requirement (new tidyverse requirement release R 4.5.0).
